title: Cruz Defends Sessions Against Democrat Accusations Regarding Russian Contacts
text:
Cruz Defends Sessions Against Democrat Accusations Regarding Russian Contacts "... a lot of political theater." by Randy DeSoto March 2, 2017 at 4:33pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, called the controversy regarding Attorney General Sessions having contacts with the Russian ambassador a “nothing burger.” 
“I think what we’re seeing is a lot of political theater,” Cruz said Thursday on MSNBC’s Morning Joe . 
“So the notion that there was something somehow wrong with a senior senator on the Armed Services Committee meeting with foreign ambassador, I think that’s a nothing burger,” he added. “That’s part of the job.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Sessions had more than 25 conversations with foreign ambassadors last year including the British, Korean, Japanese, Polish, Indian, Chinese, Canadian, Australian and German ambassadors, in addition to Russian Ambassador Sergey Kislyak, his spokeswoman stated. 
Cruz noted he has met with six different ambassadors himself in the last two months. Advertisement - story continues below 
The Texas senator’s comments came in response to a Washington Post story published Wednesday night reporting that the then senator had at least two contacts with the Russian ambassador during the presidential campaign. 
During his confirmation hearings, Sessions was asked by Sen. Al Franken, D-Minn., what he would do if he learned of any evidence that anyone affiliated with the Trump campaign communicated with the Russian government. 
“I’m not aware of any of those activities,” he responded . “I have been called a surrogate at a time or two in that campaign and I did not have communications with the Russians.” 
The attorney general issued a statement on Thursday clarifying that he had no communications with the Russian government regarding the Trump campaign. Advertisement - story continues below Father Of First SEAL To Die During Trump Administration Demands Investigation 
Concerning his testimony before the Senate Judiciary during his confirmation, Cruz stated that Sessions should have been clearer that he was responding to the question of contacts regarding the presidential campaign. 
Sessions addressed the issue at a press conference at the Department of Justice on Thursday, stating, “Let me be clear, I never had meetings with Russian operatives or Russian intermediaries about the Trump campaign.” "I have recused myself in the matters that deal with the @POTUS campaign." Watch AG Jeff Sessions' news conference. https://t.co/8G6SFWASRG pic.twitter.com/BEnYQ2WD7m 
— Fox News (@FoxNews) March 2, 2017 
“The idea that I was part of a ‘continuing exchange of information during the campaign between Trump surrogates and intermediaries for the Russian government’ is totally false,” he added. “That is the question Sen. Franken asked me at the hearing.” 
Sessions announced, based on his support of President Trump during last year’s election, that he has recused himself from “ any existing or future investigations of any matters related in any way to the campaigns for President of the United States.” What do you think?
